anime.description: Once upon a time, human voices had defined the true nature of all things, yet the invention of text changed the status quo, while creating a "Logos World" between the voice and the truth. Millennia have passed since then, advancements of civilizations have made the "Logos World" too big to control "texts." A group of young people dedicate themselves to counter chaotic "texts" with "Creative Voice Power," and among them, a boy named Akira Kaibuki living in Asagaya. Source: ANN

tag.name: robot
tag.description: A robot is an automatically guided machine, able to do tasks on its own. Another common characteristic is that by its appearance or movements, a robot often conveys a sense that it has intent or agency of its own. Not to be confused with android (human-like robot).

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: calling your attacks
tag.description: "GIGAAAAAA DRIIIIIILLL BREAKEEEEEERRR" If you can do something more impressive than just throw a punch, your attack(s) must have an equally impressive name. More than that, you have to call it out as you launch the attack. It doesn`t matter if it`s a martial arts move, a magical spell or your secret superweapon, if you can`t say its name, it just isn`t nearly as cool or effective. Having a special attack is always a must, but not impressive enough. Every special attack needs a name. A really awesome and outstanding name which is easy to remember and even easier and impressive to yell. Because it just is not enough to name your attack. No, to unleash the full power of your attack, you have to call its name in your most MANLY and LOUDEST voice. It does not matter whether it is a martial arts move, a magical spell or flying drills from your mecha, if you can`t call its name, it just isn`t nearly as cool or effective. Not a requirement but wearing shades while calling your attack makes it at least twice as cool, moreover giving your mecha or magical companion shades too results in an immeasurable level of awesomeness, bringing down every enemy just through the POWER OF YOUR VOICE. A standard feature of practically every mecha, mahou shoujo, high fantasy, or martial arts anime. [Source: TV Tropes]

tag.name: mecha
tag.description: Mecha in Japanese basically means mechanical things; everything from an electric whisk or a car to a spaceship or a robot. Here however we limit it to the more exotic things usually referred to as mecha anime: robots, whether controlled by a human or not, and their ilk. See Androids, Piloted Robots, Power Suits, Robot Helpers, Transforming Robots for a more specific classification.

tag.name: piloted robot
tag.description: Piloted Robots are, as the name suggests, robots that cannot control themselves; they need to be steered from somewhere, this can be from a human sitting inside or a remote controlled option.

tag.name: contemporary fantasy
tag.description: Contemporary fantasy, also known as modern fantasy or indigenous fantasy, is a sub-genre of fantasy, set in the present day. It is perhaps most popular for its sub-genre, urban fantasy. These terms are used to describe stories set in the putative real world (often referred to as consensus reality) in contemporary times, in which magic and magical creatures exist, either living in the interstices of our world or leaking over from alternate worlds. It thus has much in common with, and sometimes overlaps with secret history; a work of fantasy in which the magic could not remain secret or does not have any known relationship to known history would not fit into this subgenre. Occasionally certain contemporary fantasy novels will make reference to pop culture. Novels in which modern characters travel into alternate worlds, and all the magical action takes place there (except for the portal required to transport them), are not considered contemporary fantasy. Thus, C.S. Lewis`s The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe, where all fantasy events take place in the land of Narnia which is reached via a magic wardrobe, would not count as contemporary fantasy; on the other hand, the part of The Magician`s Nephew, where the Empress Jadis gets to London, tries to take over the Earth and clashes with police and a crowd of cockneys, would qualify as such. Contemporary fantasy is also to be distinguished from horror fiction, which also often has contemporary settings. When encountering magical events and creatures, the protagonist of a horror novel is horrified, while the protagonist of a fantasy novel (contemporary or otherwise) is filled with a sense of joy and wonder. Horrifying events may happen, but the fundamental distinction is vital. In his preface to That Hideous Strength, one of the earlier works falling within this sub-genre, C.S. Lewis explained why, when writing a tale about "magicians, devils, pantomime animals and planetary angels", he chose to start it with a detailed depiction of narrow-minded academic politics at a provincial English university and the schemes of crooked real estate developers: "I am following the traditional fairy-tale. We do not always notice its method, because the cottages, castles, woodcutters and petty kings with which a fairy tale opens have become for us as remote as the witches and ogres to which it proceeds. But they were not remote at all to the men who first made and enjoyed the tales". The same is true for many of the later works in the genre, which often begin with a seemingly normal scene of modern daily life to then disclose supernatural and magical beings and events hidden behind the scenes. Source: wiki

tag.name: new
tag.description: Not based on anything, the story is a new work, usually made up by the people involved in creating the anime. Generally if an original work (原作) credit is given, it will be to the studio, or director, or other members of the production team.

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: fantasy
tag.description: Fantasy is a genre of fiction that uses magic and other supernatural phenomena as a primary element of plot, theme, or setting. Many works within the genre take place in fictional worlds where magic is common. Fantasy is generally distinguished from science fiction and horror by the expectation that it steers clear of (pseudo-)scientific and macabre themes, respectively, though there is a great deal of overlap between the three (which are subgenres of speculative fiction). In popular culture, the genre of fantasy is dominated by its medievalist form, especially since the worldwide success of The Lord of the Rings books by J. R. R. Tolkien. In its broadest sense however, fantasy comprises works by many writers, artists, filmmakers, and musicians, from ancient myths and legends to many recent works embraced by a wide audience today. Fantasy is a vibrant area of academic study in a number of disciplines (English, cultural studies, comparative literature, history, medieval studies). Work in this area ranges widely, from the structuralist theory of Tzvetan Todorov, which emphasizes the fantastic as a liminal space, to work on the connections (political, historical, literary) between medievalism and popular culture Source: Wiki

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: super robot
tag.description: These robots tend to have almost semi-magical attacks, which seem impossible or non-realistic, and/or perform non-realistic transformation sequences where they seem to gain/lose mass and utterly change their form, even if it means making their super-hard armour bend like plastic sheets.

tag.name: daikaijuu
tag.description: Literally translating to giant monster, daikaiju is an element found often in Japanese entertainment. Although usually for the science fiction genre it is also often used in horror, fantasy, mecha, and to a lesser extent comedy. Any monster that towers over a house technically qualifies as a daikaiju. Some anime, usually mecha, will go as far as calling their daikaiju with a specific title.

tag.name: symbolism
tag.description: Representation of a more complex concept by a simple thing. Like a red flower for love or a flag for a nation.

tag.name: psychological
tag.description: Directed toward dealing with or affecting the mind, especially as a function of awareness, feeling, or motivation.

tag.name: happy ending
tag.description: And they lived "happily ever after"... *sniff*. All issues in the anime have been resolved, the love polygons sorted out, the conflicts resolved, the guy gets the girl (or the other way around), and everyone else lives on blissfully. (Not very realistic, but then again this is anime.)

tag.name: monster of the week
tag.description: On a pretty much regular basis — weekly or episodic — the protagonists engage in some kind of conflict. This can be an actual showdown between mecha, or the all-out fight against an enemy, or a (car) race that needs to be won. This can make the anime quite repetitive.

tag.name: ending
tag.description: This is a container tag to house meta-like tags relating to how endings of anime play out.

tag.name: ancient aliens
tag.description: Ancient aliens, hundreds, thousands, or millions of years in the past; aliens from another world or dimension played a significant role in human history. Pictured: http://anidb.net/a40 [Nadia: The Secret of The Blue Water / Fushigi no Umi no Nadia]

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

episode.title: 放て! 心射る矢
Let Fly! An Arrow That Pierces the Heart
Hanate! Kokoro Iru Ya
episode.summary: As the Verbalism Club prepares for the Tanabata Festival, Tokyo is twisted apart by a tainted love! Kokone must overcome her fears and speak her heart to overcome this powerful new M.J.B.K. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 響け! 私だけの夢
Resound! A Dream for Me Alone
Hibike! Watashi dake no Yume
episode.summary: A young, new member joins the Verbalism Club with high hopes, but something is amiss! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 照らせ! 意思の光
Shine! Light of Thought
Terase! Ishi no Hikari
episode.summary: Sougon’s power menaces with a deadly illness as the captured Maia seeks to escape from Deava’s underground facility. Will she heed her master’s command, or will she follow the voice of her conscience? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 叫べ! 創声合体
Shout! Sousei Gattai!
Sakebe! Sougoe Gattai
episode.summary: When the enigmatic Sougon unleashes the twisted power of the written word upon Tokyo, Sakurako Soda and the members of the Verbalism Club – secret soldiers of Deava – unite with the mysterious youth, Akira Kaibuki, to protect the city! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 貫け! 虫の一分
Pierce It! The Insect Part
Tsuranuke! Mushi no Ichibu
episode.summary: In the shadow of his popular comedian older brother, Tsutomu slaves away like a worker ant to make his online comedy videos. But when the world is suddenly bitten by the bug of mad ambition, Tsutomu`s off-beat comedy may be the only cure! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 燃やせ! 救世の炎
Burn It! The Savior`s Flames!
Moyase! Kyuusei no Honoo
episode.summary: Sougon uses society`s online vitriol to his advantage as a figurative flame war soon becomes literal! Can the team stop humanity from being consumed by the fires of its own hate? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 灯せ! 己の強さ
Light Up! Your Strength
Tomose! Ore no Tsuyosa
episode.summary: Feeling guilty for risking the lives of her young squadron, Sakurako moves to infiltrate Nesta herself, only to find herself face to face with Subete. She soon learns that her past ties to the shadowy organization may not be fully severed. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 取り戻せ! 俺たちの夏
Take It Back! Our Summer
Torimodose! Oretachi no Natsu
episode.summary: The girls of Shirobaco take a trip to the beach, but the rise of a new M.J.B.K. tosses their plans out in the cold! Can Akira, Tsutomu, and Hayato save the day, or will they be forced to live in a dull, passionless world without swimsuits?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 届け! 本当の声
Reach Them! My True Voice
Todoke! Hontou no Koe
episode.summary: When the Verbalism Club puts on a stage play, Kokone finally gets to live her acting dream - but on opening day, she can barely say her lines. She must find her voice quickly, as a powerful new M.J.B.K. threatens to silence her permanently! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 晴らせ! 誘[いざな]いの影
Clear Them! The Inviting Shadows
Harase! Izana no Kage
episode.summary: Maia finds herself in a strange and empty version of the world as she knows it. The voices of old allies, new friends, and a mysterious stranger beckon her - but can Maia, alone in the dark, find her footing and set out on her own path? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 重ねろ! 心と心
Bring Them Together! Heart and Heart
Kasanero! Kokoro to Shin
episode.summary: With the help of a terrifying new M.J.B.K., Subete breaks the Deava`s Aquarions apart and forces the pilots to retreat. In the wake of their defeat, Akira suddenly becomes strangely distant from his comrades… Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 羽ばたけ! 縛られた翼
Flap! Bound Wings
Habatake! Shibarareta Tsubasa
episode.summary: Stoic, industrious Hayato drafts a comprehensive operating strategy for fighting the M.J.B.K. menace, but behind his calm façade, ambition, resentment, and jealousy whirl through his mind. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 刻め! 宿命の傷
Carve Them In! The Scars of Destiny
Kizame! Shukumei no Kizu
episode.summary: In the early days of the internet, Sougon and his partner Mao Hayashi built what would become the greatest networking company in Japan: Nesta. In their quest to reach the next level of human communication, they also took in a young boy… Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 嗚呼! 青春の日々
Ah! Days of Our Youth
Aa! Seishun no Hibi
episode.summary: Out of date phrases and unpopular words make a sudden resurgence in Asagaya, and Sakurako suspects multiple M.J.B.K.s are to blame! Will her Yurei busting plan restore verbal order or will it like majorly fail? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 曝せ! 最低の自分
Show It! You at Your Worst
Sarase! Saitei no Jibun
episode.summary: A month after the battle in the Logos World, the M.J.B.K. threat seems to have disappeared - along with Sougon and Subete. As Sakurako writes up her report on the incident, a strange creature suddenly appears in the Shirobaco office! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 大勝利! 我らが救世主
A Great Victory! We Are the Saviors
Daishouri! Warera ga Kyuuseishu
episode.summary: Members of the Verbalism Club unite to take a M.J.B.K. head-on! Afterwards, Akira encounters Sougon face-to-face! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 知れ! 生まれた意味
Know It! The Reason You Were Born
Shire! Umareta Imi
episode.summary: As her friends work on Shirobaco`s third-anniversary menu, Maia digs into DEAVA`s history in an effort to save Akira. Her search leads her back to Nesta, where she learns more of her own history than she ever wanted to know... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 恋せよ! 阿佐ヶ谷
Fall in Love! Asagaya
Koi Seyo! Asagaya
episode.summary: Love is in the air in Asagaya! The members of the verbalism club pair up for a couples challenge - but Akira and Maia don`t quite know how a couple should act. Will they win the tickets, the crowns… or perhaps, something far greater? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 吠えろ! 正直な負け犬
Howl! An Honest Beaten Dog
Hoero! Shoujiki na Makeinu
episode.summary: In politics, show business, and even everyday life, people choose comforting lies over harsh realities. When a new M.J.B.K. threatens to smother the truth completely, Hayato Kujyo`s unflinching honesty may be the world`s last defense. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 砕け! 討つべきモノ
Shatter! The One I Must Strike Down
Kudake! Utsubeki Mono
episode.summary: There can be no salvation if there is no threat, no enemy. A dangerous M.J.B.K. turns friend against friend - and, lost in his obsessive desire to become a savior, Akira Kaibuki might be willing to make an enemy of the world itself… Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 出撃! 我が存在を賭けて
To Battle! With My Existence on the Line
Shutsugeki! Waga Sonzai o Kakete
episode.summary: 12,000 years ago, the struggle between the world of truth and the world of the written word was set in motion. Now, Akira Kaibuki and Subete Kenzaki prepare to bring it to its ultimate conclusion. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 蘇れ! 月夜の誓い
Revive! The Vow Beneath the Moonlight
Yomigaere! Tsukiyo no Chikai
episode.summary: With Deava`s existence now known to the world, Hayato seeks to recruit the public for their cause. Subete digs deeper into Maia`s memories, unearthing the lifelong link between Maia, Subete, and Akira. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 聞け! キミを呼ぶ声
Listen! The Voice Calling Out to You
Kike! Kimi o Yobu Koe
episode.summary: Due to the recent string of unusal events, the government turns against DEAVA and Shirobaco finds itself under siege. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 悲壮! 背徳の合体
Tragic! An Immoral Gattai
Hisou! Haitoku no Gattai
episode.summary: Maia goes to great lengths trying to save Akira, and one member of the Verbalism Club gives their all to restore order to the world. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 終わらない! アクエリオンロゴス
It Will Not End! Aquarion Logos
Owaranai! Aquarion Logos
episode.summary: Akira and Subete battle it out to save the world, and a new legend unfolds before everyone`s eyes. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 集え! 明日を望む声
Gather! Voices for Tomorrow
Tsudoe! Ashita o Nozomu Koe
episode.summary: Akira throws himself into the void for Maia`s sake, and by Nesta`s will, the written world comes to an end. What will Maia and Subete make of this new world of truth? Source: crunchyroll
